file_name: AudibleInc_20001113_10-Q_EX-10.32_2599586_EX-10.32_Co-Branding Agreement_ Marketing Agreement_ Investment Distribution Agreement.txt

perturbation.original_text: ACSI and Company are sometimes referred to collectively herein as the "Parties" and individually as a "Party."  ACSI and Company agree as follows:
perturbation.changed_text: ACSI and Company are sometimes referred to collectively herein as the "Entities" and individually as a "Party."  ACSI and Company agree as follows:
perturbation.explanation: The original text consistently uses "Parties" to refer to ACSI and Company collectively. By changing this in the introduction to "Entities," the contract creates ambiguity about whether other sections referring to "Parties" still apply to both ACSI and Company or if "Entities" represent an undefined, broader set of actors, introducing uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party will dedicate during the Term the appropriate resources and personnel necessary for establishment of the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section, the integration of the ACSI Site Functionality into the Mirror Company Site and the performance of its other obligations under this Agreement. Each Party's designated employees will be subject to change from time to time by such Party in its sole discretion and promptly upon such change such Party shall notify the other Party.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Participant will dedicate during the Term the appropriate resources and personnel necessary for establishment of the Spoken-Word Audio Sub-Section, the integration of the ACSI Site Functionality into the Mirror Company Site and the performance of its other obligations under this Agreement. Each Party's designated employees will be subject to change from time to time by such Party in its sole discretion and promptly upon such change such Party shall notify the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: The original text consistently uses "Party" to refer to ACSI and Company. Introducing the term "Participant" creates ambiguity: is a "Participant" the same as a "Party", or could it include affiliates or other related entities? This confusion can lead to disputes regarding responsibility for resource allocation and personnel dedication.

perturbation.original_text: Neither Company nor ACSI will use the other Party's Trademarks in a manner that disparages the other Party or its products or services, and/or portrays the other Party or its products or services in a false, competitively adverse or poor light.  Each of Company and ACSI will comply with the other Party's requests as to the use of the other Party's Trademarks and will avoid knowingly taking any action that diminishes the value of such Trademarks.
perturbation.changed_text: Neither Company nor ACSI will use the other Entity's Trademarks in a manner that disparages the other Party or its products or services, and/or portrays the other Party or its products or services in a false, competitively adverse or poor light.  Each of Company and ACSI will comply with the other Party's requests as to the use of the other Party's Trademarks and will avoid knowingly taking any action that diminishes the value of such Trademarks.
perturbation.explanation: In the first sentence, the term "Entity" replaced "Party". This implies that there are more entities involved other than ACSI and Company. However, the following sentences continue referring to "Parties" which suggests ACSI and Company. This is conflicting since the first sentence opens the possibility of a third-party or other business structure.
